text: Cheerilee something hi everyone
Anthony Fantino here the Internet's
busiest music nerd up high down low dude
slow it's time for an album review
chairlift something chairlift is that
New York band that hit it kind of big a
handful of years ago after landing one
of their singles in iPod commercial the
song bruises and the song got him a lot
of attention and it's not hard to see
why I enjoyed the song really catchy
hook lovesick lyrics really cute boy or
girl duet dynamic going on the buzz
behind them was getting so big they
ended up getting signed to Columbia
Records and their first album got
reissued through that record label and I
did listen to the album but it didn't
really stick with me you know just kind
of felt like light simple indie pop it's
got some nice synths but not a lot of
lasting power you know kind of like you
eat a meal and then you're hungry like
just five minutes later I'm not a big
fan of meals like that or music like
that now chairlift has this sophomore
album out titled something on Columbia
Records and it's definitely more mature
than the previous LP these guys are
definitely not just an indie pop band or
a synth pop band anymore chairlift
went back did its homework started
pulling out some post-punk bass lines
and some New Wave drumbeats and some art
pop sensibilities this combo comes
together and it's kicked off really well
on the first track which has this bass
line that is just all over the place
some really nice rhythms and these
synthesizers that just wail with this
really bright tone that kind of makes
them sound like they should be in a
theme song to a sixty sci-fi television
show and frontwoman Caroline Poehler
checks voice just has this really wide
range a lot of personality she is
singing
and also kind of doing these narrations
these spoken word bits it just makes the
song feel really eccentric really fun
really strange it's just like futuristic
synth pop but not like future futuristic
sand pop kind of like what I'm sure
people in the 80s would imagine all
music would sound like in 2012 and I get
that feel because the sense the vocals
the drums they all come together into
this really sleek smooth total package
that feels a little icy but some of the
songs on here have a quirky quality to
them too which kind of humanizes this LP
makes it fun makes it feel a lot less
robotic and boring like the song frigid
spring which has definitely the weirdest
vocal melody on the entire LP and I
think it's the most memorable for it and
the other track that to me has a lot of
personality is the first single to come
off of this LP came out with a video for
it last year and then a man named Misha
there are more narrations on that track
and synthesizers just gliding along
really beautifully in the background
there are all these segues between the
verses and choruses vocals popping up in
every direction lots of different sounds
and details it's clear this track got a
little extra spice a little extra
attention and I don't feel like every
song on this album did tracks like met
before I belong in your arms and ghosts
tonight those tracks to me mhm they've
got catchy hooks and and overall they're
decent songs but they give up the course
is so easily it's like the verses aren't
even there
these tracks to me just feel much much
simpler like they're just kind of
playing as straight the vocals don't
feel a strange or or as emotive and
musically these tracks to me don't throw
out as many ideas either those tracks
definitely do not hit me like the song
cool is fire which to me is easily the
most beautiful track on this album the
beat on that track is really
Asia's feels almost a little tribal and
the synths in the background just kind
of swell up like like their strings or
something and the vocals are really
spotlighted on this track they really
capture this idea of loneliness and just
to range the melody that is being sung
with the vocals it's gorgeous I wish
more songs on here just felt as as
tender as loving as gentle I kind of
really feel like I'm a rock to sleep
with that song after listening to this
thing over and over it's clear that that
all the songs are are pretty decent you
know all of them have good hooks but not
every song overall has a captivating or
fun or interesting personality it just
makes some of the songs on this LP
forgettable you know and I think
chairlift is kind of yet to hammer out
their own niche in the sound that
they're playing with because I think
it's a little too easy to kind of tack
them on to the ever-growing list of
bands that are just drowning in this
nostalgia for the 80s there are so many
points on this LP where I kind of feel
like I'm listening to the second coming
of whom or the cockatoo twins usually
stuff like that ruins albums for me but
not necessarily in this case because the
songs are so good I'm feeling that a
light too decent seven on this thing but
but but what do you think about this
thing do you love it do you hate it why
and what do you think I should review
next anthony Fantana chairlift current
